item.description: 2020-09-07 readelf -r on .o files -> looks for particular relocations -> instead of -a it checks if we’re getting the right relocation

item.title: 2020-10-02 - Relocations
item.description: 2020-10-02 - Relocations what is complain and overflow? howto_table in bfd/elfxx-riscv.c what is size? bitsize? pc relative is a pc relative rellocation

item.title: 2022-06-17 - Jeremy Relocation Notes
item.description: 2022-06-17 - Jeremy Relocation Notes end of linker -> introduce the issue of being no mechanism for vendor specific relocation -> discuss issue of relocations, we can do vendor specific but not vendor specific relocations.
2022-07-04 CORE-V We have a static relocation in bfd/elfnn-riscv.c (perform_relocation) which switches on the instruction type and encodes the instruction.

item.title: Fixups
item.description: Fix-ups Fix-ups are used to represent information in instructions which is currently unknown. During instruction encoding, if some information is unknown (such as a memory location of an external symbol), it is encoded as if the value is equal to 0 and a fix-up is emitted which contains information on how to rewrite the value when information is known.

item.title: GNU
item.description: GNU Extensive collection of free software which can be used as an operating system or in parts with other operating systems.

item.title: Howto Table
item.description: Howto Table a.k.a. Relocation Table The relocation table records the list of items that the file needs (from other object files or libraries).

item.title: Notes on relocation-prototype from 02-06-2022
item.description: Notes on relocation-prototype: Assuming we already have RELOCID in place: There is a bool pretend_im_corev in gas/config/tc-riscv.c which sets the relocation as CORE-V.

item.title: Notes on relocation-prototype from 23-06-2022
item.description: Notes on Relocation Handling Prototype I think I am getting this error: 1 2 ../bfd/.libs/libbfd.a(elf32-riscv.o): In function `perform_relocation': /home/pietraferreira/corev/build/binutils-gdb/bfd/elfnn-riscv.

item.title: Relocations
item.description: Relocations What is a relocation? They are very common in position-dependant code and implemented at link time. Before linking, an instruction might need a label which gets assigned a temporary symbolic reference.
